definition: to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: He made us all laugh by mimicking the teacher's voice.
sentences.chinese: 他模仿老师的声音，逗得我们哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: They laughed and banged at the door.
sentences.chinese: 他们哈哈大笑地锤打洗手间的门。

sentences.english: After a short silence, he burst inro laughter.
sentences.chinese: 在沉默片刻后，他突然哈哈大笑起来。

sentences.english: One day she saw his bi-lingual name cards and howled with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 一天，她看到了他的双语名片，哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: The librarian threw back his head and laughed shrilly.
sentences.chinese: 图书管理员把头往后面一仰，尖着嗓子哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: After listening, he laughed out loud.
Father used to chortle over the funny funny papers every Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 父亲以前每个星期天看到滑稽报纸，总要哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: Even the low-brow books could also make him burst into laughter.
sentences.chinese: 极俗的书他也能看得哈哈大笑。
他停下手头的工作哈哈大笑起来。

sentences.english: The children laughed with glee at the clown 's antics.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们让小丑的滑稽动作逗得哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: Some of the devotees smiled to themselves. The Master laughed.
sentences.chinese: 一些奉献者也微笑起来，师父哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: Melrose reared his arm back to strike, then burst into laughter.
sentences.chinese: 麦罗斯向后挥着手臂猛击，然后哈哈大笑起来。

sentences.english: The joke he said set me laughing loud.
sentences.chinese: 他讲的那个笑话逗得我哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: Ralph , Jr. looks back at her and laughs idiotically.
sentences.chinese: 小拉尔夫回头看着她，傻傻地哈哈大笑起来。

sentences.english: Father tried to make Henry laugh by moving his Adam's apple up and down.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸把他的喉结上下移动，逗得亨利哈哈大笑。

sentences.english: We were very amused by her comments.
sentences.chinese: 我们被她的评论逗得哈哈大笑。

definition: to howl with laughter/to laugh one's head off
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
